result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L. Maksimik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew L. Maksimik is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew L. Maksimik was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $917.00 plus surcharges (remainder of restitution to be determined at hearing on 4/22/16).

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person. Clerk/H. Barnett. Issue of outstanding restitution and court costs. ADA Phan states the deft has almost paid off the restitution. Deft believes he can pay the balance of restitution by 5/21/18. Court orders probation extended for 20 days, to terminate when remaining balance of restitution is paid after which a civil judgment is entered on any outstanding court costs.

Deft's probation is extended for 45 days from current discharge date or until all court obligations are completed.
(copy sent to P&P)
Probation review hearing on May 18, 2018 at 08:45 am.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person. Clerk/H. Barnett. Isue of unpaid restitution and court costs. Deft states he just started a new job and can pay it off within a couple of months. Court orders probation extended for 45 days; may terminate early if paid prior to that date. PRH continued to 5/18/18 at 8:45am.
